data.text:
@AntonioTweets2 "Never was a pandemic"â€¦ tell me, where'd you get your doctorate in virology?  Did you even graduate high school?

With 3.33 million cases in Canada, a 0.012% mortality rate would mean only about 370 people have died of Covid in Canada. Math is HARD, isn't it?

@AntonioTweets2 You must know that this meme you posted is ridiculously false. Even a kid in grade 4 knows that the mortality rate is about 1.2%, not 0.012%, which is down significantly from a 3.5% mortality rate before vaccines were available.

If math is too hard for you, ask a child to help.
